_header: Man if thou wilt hear / Right good thing thou might lere
Note:
Part of the ‘Continuation’ of Handlyng Synne (1283) for which see Sullivan (1978)
XSullivan, S. A. “Handlyng Synne in Its Tradition: A Study of Robert Mannyng of Brunne’s Handlyng Synne and Its Relation to Other Instructional Works, in Order to Establish the Place of the Poem in Its Genre.” Diss. Cambridge, 1978. Other sections are 378, 1598, 3099, 3339, 3355.
_description: The Seven Works of Mercy, some illustrated by Narrationes — 229 lines in couplets

CULIi49.First Lines:
Man if þu wylt hereRyth good thyng þu maȝt
                    lere…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Qua we ben dede þat we may wendeTo blys þat neuer
                    xal haue ende

BLHar3954.First Lines: Man ȝyf þu wylt hereRyth good thyng þu myth lere…
BLHar3954.Last Lines: …Quan we ben dede þat we moun wendeTo blys þat neuer xal han endeAmen Amen Amen
BLHar3954.Attributed Title: Hic incipiunt vii facta elemosine sicut euangeliste testatur (rubric above first line, f. 81rb)
